titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Chanticleer Photograph Collection, 1990s-ongoing UA.31.01.0003
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Kim Sims; machine-readable finding aid created by: Sherrie Bowser

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-03-01 12:45:12 -0500.

change.item: Converted from dtd to schema, transformed with AT-import-fixer.xsl, and imported to Archivists Toolkit

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Chanticleer is Duke's annual student-produced yearbook. Focus is placed on high- quality photographs. The collection includes photographs, slides, negatives and contact sheets. Duplicates exist throughout the collection. The Collection also includes editing notes from Chanticleer staff. Most of the photographs are in black and white, although there are some in color. They range in date from circa 1998-ongoing.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Chanticleer Photograph Collection, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Chanticleer Photograph Collection were received by the University Archives as a transfer in 2002-2003, 2012, and 2018.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions A2002-75, A2003-1, and UA2012-0001 were merged into one collection, described in this finding aid.
Accession UA2018.0010 added by Tracy M. Jackson, February 2021.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: The Chanticleer is Duke's annual student-produced yearbook. The first issue was published in 1912. Its production is managed by the Undergraduate Publications Board.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Chanticleer Photograph Collection includes photographs, slides, negatives and contact sheets. Duplicates exist throughout the collection. The collection also includes editing notes from Chanticleer staff. Most of the photographs are in black and white, although there are some in color, and the majority of them are unidentified. They range in date from circa 1990s-ongoing.
